title.narrative: Burundi (le): Aide ciblée aux pays
Burundi: Targeted country assistance

description.narrative:
Plans d’assistance technique ciblée aux pays L’assistance technique ciblée aux pays (TCA) est octroyée sous forme de ressources destinées aux partenaires présents dans les pays. La TCA est un élément du cadre d’engagement avec les partenaires (PEF) de Gavi. Le plan de TCA d’un pays est établie selon les besoins exprimés du dit pays lors de l’évaluation conjointe. Un plan comprend une liste d’activités, d’étapes clés, et un budget pour une année dite. L’assistance technique est un soutien non financier fourni par des spécialistes. Elle peut revêtir plusieurs formes : partage d’information et de savoir-faire, formation et services-conseils.
L’assistance technique fournie dans le cadre du PEF est appelée aide ciblée aux pays. Ce type de soutien vise principalement à payer le personnel basé en permanence dans les bureaux pays des partenaires. Il repose sur la demande et les besoins identifiés par les pays eux-mêmes.

Targeted country assistance (TCA) are resources provided to in-country partners under Gavi’s partners’ engagement framework (PEF). A country’s TCA plan is based on needs expressed by the country during the joint appraisal discussions. It includes sets of activities, milestones and budget for a given year.Technical assistance is non-financial support provided by specialists. It can take the form of sharing information and expertise, training and consulting services.
The technical assistance provided through PEF is called targeted country assistance (TCA). This type of support mainly consists of staff permanently based in partners’ country offices. It is based on the demand and needs identified by the countries themselves.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Supply Chain & Procurement
At least 98 % of all installed SDD refrigerator are working

target.value: Support MoH/ PEV for post installation follow up and monitoring of solar refrigerators newly installed

comment.narrative: 99% (789/797)of SDD refrigerator from health districts and health centers are working.

target.value: Support MoH/ PEV for post installation follow up and monitoring of solar refrigerators newly installed

comment.narrative: 99% (789/797)of SDD refrigerator from health districts and health centers are working.

title.narrative: At least 80% of all districts have good score (based on national check list) in waste management

target.value: Support the MoH/ EPI to strengthen the management of vaccine waste at all levels

comment.narrative: At the national level, a contract was concluded between the EPI and a local Institution (INSP) for the waste management (destruction) from vaccines delivery. At the operational level (health district and health center), waste management has been taken into account in the new SPOs for logistic and vaccine management and cascade training on these new SPOs has been started by health district staff (vaccine managers and EPI Focal points). The training will be continued in the next quarter to train health center staff on the new SOPs. The evaluation of waste management at all levels will be conducted early in July with EVM.

target.value: Support the MoH/ EPI to strengthen the management of vaccine waste at all levels

comment.narrative: At the national level, a contract was concluded between the EPI and a local Institution (INSP) for the waste management (destruction) from vaccines delivery. At the operational level (health district and health center), waste management has been taken into account in the new SPOs for logistic and vaccine management and cascade training on these new SPOs has been started by health district staff (vaccine managers and EPI Focal points). The training will be continued in the next quarter to train health center staff on the new SOPs. The evaluation of waste management at all levels will be conducted early in July with EVM.

title.narrative: At least 90% of health district has no reported stock out issues

target.value: Support MoH/ EPI to build capacity of EPI staff at all levels on the vaccines and logistics tools (EPILOG, Forecast, SMT)

comment.narrative: Staff from national and district levels have been trained. At 98% of health district has reported zero stock out for vaccines and injection devices.

target.value: Support MoH/ EPI to build capacity of EPI staff at all levels on the vaccines and logistics tools (EPILOG, Forecast, SMT)

comment.narrative: Staff from national and district levels have been trained. At 98% of health district has reported zero stock out for vaccines and injection devices.

title.narrative: 100% of the construction work is already done: The rehabilitation /construction of offices and stocks of 3 Health Districts has been finalized

target.value: Support the rehabilitation/construction of offices and stocks of EPI and Health Districts

comment.narrative: The construction of offices and stocks of 2 health districts is finalized. The provisional acceptance of the works took place in May 2021. The construction of the 3rd district will be finalized soon, its reception is scheduled for July 2021.

target.value: Support the rehabilitation/construction of offices and stocks of EPI and Health Districts

comment.narrative: The construction of offices and stocks of 2 health districts is finalized. The provisional acceptance of the works took place in May 2021. The construction of the 3rd district will be finalized soon, its reception is scheduled for July 2021.

title.narrative: At least 80% of districts have implemented continuous monitoring system of temperature of the cold chain equipment

target.value: Support MoH/ PEV for installation of continuous monitoring system of temperature of the cold chain equipment at central and district levels

comment.narrative: Funds to purchase the devices are not yet available. However, a pilot phase in 25 storage sites (16 health centers, 8 HD and at central level) will be carried out in December 2021. Th training will start on 29th November 2021, follow with the installation of the devices in different sites

target.value: Support MoH/ PEV for installation of continuous monitoring system of temperature of the cold chain equipment at central and district levels

comment.narrative: This activity is delayed due to lack of funds to purchase the equipment of continuous monitoring system. The acquisition of this equipment is scheduled for the second semester of 2021.

target.value: Support MoH/ PEV for installation of continuous monitoring system of temperature of the cold chain equipment at central and district levels

comment.narrative: This activity is delayed due to lack of funds to purchase the equipment of continuous monitoring system. The acquisition of this equipment is scheduled for the second semester of 2021.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Health Information Systems (Data)
At least two modules are integrated in DHIS2

target.value: Strengthen national capacities on DHIS2 Management at all levels and initiate the interoperability with other existing databases by involving the partnership between GAVI Alliance and the University of Oslo

comment.narrative: Administrators training had been conducted in April/May ; now the work to integrate RapidSMS and iCCM inputs Management applications is in on progress.

target.value: Strengthen national capacities on DHIS2 Management at all levels and initiate the interoperability with other existing databases by involving the partnership between GAVI Alliance and the University of Oslo

comment.narrative: Administrators training had been conducted in April/May ; now the work to integrate RapidSMS and iCCM inputs Management applications is in on progress.

title.narrative: At least two capacity building workshops conducted at sub-national level, and initial BNA indicators validated

target.value: Strengthening of national health information system (HIS), through better quality and use of immunisation data - through BNA, Action Tracker & Scorecards applications for DHIS2

comment.narrative: An joint evaluation followed by updating pro-equity micro-plans was carried out for 18 DS in 2020. In 2021, an BNA analysis and indicators validation are programmed for the 2021 third quarter in preparation for the DHIS2 BNA application

title.narrative: At least two nationl workshops and 3 decetralised workshops organised to implement the pilot phase of electronic register

target.value: Support the MoH (DSNIS & PEV) to establish an electronic register for vaccination

comment.narrative: Due to Covid-19 the activity was delayed but now, with UNICEF support, the EPI prepare the readiness assessment which is planned for the third quarter of this year 2021 with support from RO. Next step will be to implement a pilot project of electronic register in some health districts.

target.value: Support the MoH (DSNIS & PEV) to establish an electronic register for vaccination

comment.narrative: Due to Covid-19 the activity was delayed but now, with UNICEF support, the EPI prepare the readiness assessment which is planned for the third quarter of this year 2021 with support from RO. Next step will be to implement a pilot project of electronic register in some health districts.

target.value: Support the MoH (DSNIS & PEV) to establish an electronic register for vaccination

comment.narrative: The activity is postponed for the 1st semester of 2022

title.narrative: At least 2 pilote health districts using the BNA, Action Tracker & Scorecards applications for DHIS2 during their quarterly reviews

target.value: Strengthening of national health information system (HIS), through better quality and use of immunisation data - through BNA, Action Tracker & Scorecards applications for DHIS2

comment.narrative: Due to covid-19, the activity is delayed. The BNA application is not yet installed. With the support with RO, an implementation plan is set to install an BNA and action tracker app on DHIS2 for the third and fourth quarter .

target.value: Strengthening of national health information system (HIS), through better quality and use of immunisation data - through BNA, Action Tracker & Scorecards applications for DHIS2

comment.narrative: Due to covid-19, the activity is delayed. The BNA application is not yet installed. With the support with RO, an implementation plan is set to install an BNA and action tracker app on DHIS2 for the third and fourth quarter .

target.value: Strengthening of national health information system (HIS), through better quality and use of immunisation data - through BNA, Action Tracker & Scorecards applications for DHIS2

comment.narrative: We prepare a workshop to identify tracer interventions and their indicators for which bottlenecks will be analyzed using DHIS2 data. Afterwards, application configuration will be made in the DHIS2 and the bottleneck analysis will follow

title.narrative: UNICEF : Programme Implementation/Coverage & Equity
At least 80% of health districts have updated their pro-equity micro-plans

target.value: Support microplanning of immunization activities at the district level to improve coverage and equity

comment.narrative: Due to a lack of funds for this activity, only 18 DS out of 47 (38%) have updated their pro-equity micro-plans.

title.narrative: An urban strategy to increase the performance in immunization is available

target.value: Support the MoH/ EPI for the elaboration of an urban strategy to increase the performance in immunization of Health Districts in Bujumbura City and other urban centers

comment.narrative: The ToR for the activity have been developped and share with the MoH . The activity is late for two reasons: - Difficulty for resources mobilizing for operational costs (Situation analysis workshop with all stakeholders; strategy appropriation workshop which will be developed with the international consultant support) -Availability of the international consultant in the context of Covid-19.

title.narrative: A joint evaluation of second-generation pro-equity micro-plans has been completed

target.value: Support microplanning of immunization activities at the district level to improve coverage and equity

comment.narrative: The 18 priority HD have reviewed and updated their pro-equity micro-plans. With support from Gavi HSS3 , the implementation of pro-equity micro-plans are ongoing. The review of their micro-plans will be conducted in the first semester of 2022. Support was give also for the development of micro-plans in 31 other health districts that did not have one

target.value: Support microplanning of immunization activities at the district level to improve coverage and equity

comment.narrative: The activity was postponed due to lack of funds for operational costs. This activity will take place in the second semester 2021.

target.value: Support microplanning of immunization activities at the district level to improve coverage and equity

comment.narrative: The activity was postponed due to lack of funds for operational costs. This activity will take place in the second semester 2021.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Service Delivery
At least one health district in Bujumbura city implement the urban strategy to increase coverage and equity

target.value: Support the MoH/ EPI for implementation of urban strategy to increase the performance and equity in immunization of Health Districts in Bujumbura City

comment.narrative: Due to the Covid-19 context, the avaibility of a international consultant still a challenge to complete this activity. ToR have been developed and republished, the recruitment process is underway.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Financial/General Management
The plan for maintaining maternal and noenatal tetanus elimination status is updated.

target.value: Support the EPI in the planning, implementaion, coordination, monitoring and evaluation of immunization activities (RED and microplans implementation, organization of coordination meetings, GTSME meetings, staff training, supervisions, development of the annual action plan, updating of strategic documents: Maintenance plan, guide technique du PEV, MNT elimination status, national measles and rubella elimination strategy)

comment.narrative: Due to the unavailability of funds, the plan for maintaining MNT elimination is not yet updated. The activity has been postponed to the first semester of 2022.

title.narrative: EPI Annual workplan 2021-2022 and budgets including interventions to reach zero dose children in place

target.value: Support the EPI in the planning, implementaion, coordination, monitoring and evaluation of immunization activities (RED and microplans implementation, organization of coordination meetings, GTSME meetings, staff training, supervisions, development of the annual action plan, updating of strategic documents: Maintenance plan, guide technique du PEV, MNT elimination status, national measles and rubella elimination strategy)

comment.narrative: UNICEF give support to the EPI to prepare and finalize its Annual Working 2021-2022.

title.narrative: WHO : Health Information Systems (Data)

1) At least 90% of Health districts have perfomance indicators of AFP and measles in the norms
2) 1 global feedback bulletin on the 47 DS is produced each month. In total 12 bulletins producted annualy

target.value: Support surveillance of vaccine-preventable diseases ( AFP, measles, maternal neonatal tetanus, congenital rubella, meningitis, diarrhea rotavirus ...)

comment.narrative: 2 supervisions intégrées ont été réalisées au cours de l année 2020 -2021 et ont montré des progrès significatifs dans la surveillance des MEV. L évaluation des données a montré que les indicateurs de suivi de la surveillance de la rougeole sont de 15, 58 et le taux d éruption non rougeoleuse est de 3, 23 et pour la surveillance des PFA, la proportion de districts ayant atteint les 2 indicateurs de performance (le taux de PFA non polio =2/100000 et une proportion sup à 80% d?échantillons adéquats) : 17,02% (8 DS/47) Taux d?entérovirus non polio : 7,9% (seuil : >=10%) et Taux de PFA non Polio = 2,11 p 100000 = 2). Les défis c est qu il reste encore 17% des districts qui sont silencieux pour la surveillance des PFA et .2 épidémies de rougeole ont connu des ripostes appuyées par l OMS. Aujourdh ui meme si le pays est mûr pour une campagne nationale de rougeole, seuls 2 districts sont en épidémie depuis Février 2021. l OMS appuie le pays dans l Approvisionnement regulier en reactifs de rougeole.

target.value: Support surveillance of vaccine-preventable diseases ( AFP, measles, maternal neonatal tetanus, congenital rubella, meningitis, diarrhea rotavirus ...)

comment.narrative: 2 supervisions intégrées ont été réalisées au cours de l année 2020 -2021 et ont montré des progrès significatifs dans la surveillance des MEV. L évaluation des données a montré que les indicateurs de suivi de la surveillance de la rougeole sont de 15, 58 et le taux d éruption non rougeoleuse est de 3, 23 et pour la surveillance des PFA, la proportion de districts ayant atteint les 2 indicateurs de performance (le taux de PFA non polio =2/100000 et une proportion sup à 80% d?échantillons adéquats) : 17,02% (8 DS/47) Taux d?entérovirus non polio : 7,9% (seuil : >=10%) et Taux de PFA non Polio = 2,11 p 100000 = 2). Les défis c est qu il reste encore 17% des districts qui sont silencieux pour la surveillance des PFA et .2 épidémies de rougeole ont connu des ripostes appuyées par l OMS. Aujourdh ui meme si le pays est mûr pour une campagne nationale de rougeole, seuls 2 districts sont en épidémie depuis Février 2021. l OMS appuie le pays dans l Approvisionnement regulier en reactifs de rougeole.

title.narrative: 1. The AEFI monitoring system is functional at the operational level ( Health Districit and Health facilities) . At operational level: 1) At least 1 trained provider in each Health Center and Hospital in the country; 2)At least 2 trained provider in each health district management team 3) Reporting tools of the AEFIs are available and used; 4) 100% (47) Health District notify cases of AEFI. 2. The specific tools for pharmacovigilance are produced and disseminated.

target.value: Support the MSPLS to strengthen the national pharmacovigilance system and surveillance of AEFI

comment.narrative: Le consultant a été recruté et son chronogramme validé par le comité de pilotage. Le comité technique mis en place est compsé de l equipe de l OMS , de IST et du bureau pays pour faire le suivi des travaux. Le comité MAPI est en cours de redynamisation

title.narrative: 1) The national pharmacovigilance committee is set up and functional and The first meeting report is available

target.value: Support the MSPLS to strengthen the national pharmacovigilance system and surveillance of AEFI

comment.narrative: le consultant a été recruté et a partagé son chrogramme avec le comité de pilotage qui l a validé. La redynamisation du comité de pharmacoviligeance est prévue d ici la fin du mois de Juin 2021

target.value: Support the MSPLS to strengthen the national pharmacovigilance system and surveillance of AEFI

comment.narrative: le consultant a été recruté et a partagé son chrogramme avec le comité de pilotage qui l a validé. La redynamisation du comité de pharmacoviligeance est prévue d ici la fin du mois de Juin 2021

title.narrative: WHO : Vaccine-Specific Support

1)100% (47 District) have micro plans, of which 18 are implemented and monitored. the recommendations to find and catch up with the zeros doses are followed. 2) Assessment reports are available. recommendations from data reviews are monitored.3)The multisectoral platform for maternal and child health is extended to all stakeholders.4)At least 80 % of NITAG meeting held and 2 recommandations are implemented

target.value: Technical Assistant for coverage and equity/Program Implementation for the immunization. EPI support for the next submission of the System strengthening grant;(P4)

comment.narrative: 100%(47districts) disposent de microplans. Les 29 qui restaient ont leurs microplans disponibles Les 18 autres sont en cours de mise en oeuvre.leur évaluation débutera en 2022.

title.narrative: Measles campaign report available

target.value: Support the Planning, Implementation and Monitoring of the Measles Vaccination Campaign in Burundi

comment.narrative: Le processus de recrutement du consultant est finalisé et la campagnes est prévue dans la période de Octobre à Décembre 2021. Le consultant va procéder à l elaboration des micro-plans des districts et à la planification de la campagne. Le budget a été validé par GAVI mais n est pas encore disponible au Burundi. En attendant nous constatons que le pays est mûr pour une campagne et 2 province sont en épidémie (BUBANZA et BUGARAMA). A ce jour le nombe de cas de rougeole à la semaine 23 est de 366 et zero décès.

target.value: Support the Planning, Implementation and Monitoring of the Measles Vaccination Campaign in Burundi

comment.narrative: Le processus de recrutement du consultant est finalisé et la campagnes est prévue dans la période de Octobre à Décembre 2021. Le consultant va procéder à l elaboration des micro-plans des districts et à la planification de la campagne. Le budget a été validé par GAVI mais n est pas encore disponible au Burundi. En attendant nous constatons que le pays est mûr pour une campagne et 2 province sont en épidémie (BUBANZA et BUGARAMA). A ce jour le nombe de cas de rougeole à la semaine 23 est de 366 et zero décès.

target.value: Support the Planning, Implementation and Monitoring of the Measles Vaccination Campaign in Burundi

comment.narrative: la campagne rougeole a été repoussée jusqu en Décembre 2021(du 14 au 17 Décembre 2021). cependant l OMS a recruté un consultant qui va soutenir les activités de micro planification.

title.narrative: pro-equity micro- plan including zero-dose children approch are implemented in the 18 priorities districts

target.value: Ensure national coverage in pro-equity micro-plans: support the development of pro-equity micro-plans in 100% health districts and support its implementation. support to the developement, implementation and evaluation of pro-equity-micro plans

comment.narrative: Les activités inscrites dans les 18 microplans prioritaires prennent en compte l approche zero doses. Leur mise en oeuvre est en cours et fera l objet d évaluation en 2022

title.narrative: 1) assessment of the implementation of the annual plan (AAP 2020) is carried out and the recommendations integrated into the annual plan 2021-2022 (AAP 2021).2)NITAG members are trained to formulate recommandations for the introduction of new vaccines.3)2 recommendations are submitted to decision makers for the introduction of HB0 and HPV

target.value: Technical Assistant for coverage and equity/Program Implementation for the immunization. EPI support for the next submission of the System strengthening grant;(P4)

comment.narrative: Un draft des termes de reference du cadre de redevabilité pour la vaccination au niveau communautaire est disponible. La validation est prévue au courant du semestre prochain.La mise en oeuvre des 18 microplans des districts prioritaires va démarrer le prochain semestre. L'OMS va mobiliser des fonds pour 3 séances de rattrapage des enfants sous vaccinés et des zero doses.

title.narrative: The Heb0 vaccine is introduced into the routine EPI

target.value: Support the country in planning, implementing and monitoring the introduction of new vaccines ( Hepatitis at birth_Heb0)

comment.narrative: le consultant est recruté. Le pays va soumettre à la prochaine fenêtre prévue en Septembre 2021 à défaut ce sera la 1ère fenêtre de 2021. Le consultant avec l aval du PEV pourra appuyer l laboration du document de soumission pour l introduction des nouveaux vaccins(HPV et HB0)

target.value: Support the country in planning, implementing and monitoring the introduction of new vaccines ( Hepatitis at birth_Heb0)

comment.narrative: le consultant est recruté. Le pays va soumettre à la prochaine fenêtre prévue en Septembre 2021 à défaut ce sera la 1ère fenêtre de 2021. Le consultant avec l aval du PEV pourra appuyer l laboration du document de soumission pour l introduction des nouveaux vaccins(HPV et HB0)

title.narrative: 1.Microplanification of Measles campaign is available in each district. 2. Intra-campaign monitoring coverage surveydone

target.value: Support the Planning, Implementation and Monitoring of the Measles Vaccination Campaign in Burundi

comment.narrative: le recrutement du consultant est en cours. Les TDR ont été élaborés et publiés. La selection du candidat est fait mais la campagne a été reportée jusqu en Octobre 2021.

title.narrative: WHO : Supply Chain & Procurement
At least 80% of the EVM recommendations are implemented. The evaluation implemented report is available.

target.value: Support the EPI for the implementation of the EVM

comment.narrative: Les recommandations de la GEV sont mises en oeuvre par les formations sanitaires. Les procédures opérationnelles ont été élaborées, les gestionnaires et agents de santé ont été formés. Le consultant qui va appuyer l évaluation externe de la GEV est également recruté et le processus suit son cours.

target.value: Support the EPI for the implementation of the EVM

comment.narrative: Les recommandations de la GEV sont mises en oeuvre par les formations sanitaires. Les procédures opérationnelles ont été élaborées, les gestionnaires et agents de santé ont été formés. Le consultant qui va appuyer l évaluation externe de la GEV est également recruté et le processus suit son cours.

title.narrative: UNICEF
The construction/rehabilitation has started (If the funds are available)

target.value: Study and carry out an extension / rehabilitation of an EPI storage warehouse

comment.narrative: Construction works for EPI storage warehouse rehabilitation have not yet started. Fundraising is underway. The technical assistance expected from UNICEF for this activity is the recruitment of a construction company and the supervision of construction works. The funds for construction are not planned in either the 2020 TCA funds or the 2021 TCA funds. They are planned in the HSS3 additional funds currently under negotiation.

title.narrative: At least one orientation workshop conducted at national level, with the support of ESARO and Oslo University

target.value: Strengthening of national health information system (HIS), through better quality and use of immunisation data - through BNA, Action Tracker & Scorecards applications for DHIS2

comment.narrative: Instead of a workshop, dur to covid, One Orientation meeting (zoom meeting) were held between ESARO, HISP (OSLO representative) and MoH on the strenghning of HIS through the DHIS2 support.

title.narrative: * Number of Community Health worker Trained on the monitoring of pregnant and child (including the vaccination) in the community and register them in Rapidms system * At Least one person in every health facility is able to enter data in the Rapidsms data

target.value: Extend the SMSRapid project on monitoring the child / one thousand days, including the recovery of irregular / abandoned in the 18 priority DS

comment.narrative: Same comments for Nonvember 2020 report: Funds for the training of CHWs of the 18 HDs on RapidSMS for vaccination are not yet available. However, with UNICEF funds, 1410 CHWs of the 6 HD in two provinces (Gitega and Cankuzo) are already using this RapidSMS technology for recalling and catching up children for immunization in these HD. The 6 HD are not included in the 18 HD initially planned.

Due to Covid-19 these activity was delayed but now, with UNICEF support, the EPI prepare the readiness assessment which is planned for the third quarter of this year 2021 with support from RO. Next step will be to implement a pilot project of electronic register in some health districts.

title.narrative: At least 20 additional public and private centers and clinics offering immunization services

target.value: Support the EPI for the establishment of a public-private partnership roadmap in the provision of immunization services: Private partners mapping and their areas of services, advocacy and engagement

comment.narrative: The mapping of health facilities with vaccination services in the three health districts of the Bujumbura city has been finalized. The identification of health facilities to be accredited for vaccination services in Bujumbura city has been made and discussed with the EPI manager. An advocacy workshop with these private structures is planned at the beginning of July 2021 to get their commitment to offer immunization services.

title.narrative: National Immunization Policy and Immunization Law Adopted

target.value: Support the country in implementing the Immunization Resource Mobilization Strategy

comment.narrative: This activity was delayed due to Covid-19. The country was unable to have an international consultant for this activity.

target.value: Support the country in implementing the Immunization Resource Mobilization Strategy

comment.narrative: This activity was delayed due to Covid-19. The country was unable to have an international consultant for this activity.

target.value: Support the country in implementing the Immunization Resource Mobilization Strategy

title.narrative: A special allocation budget (mother and child health fund) is established in the general state budget to further mobilize public resources for immunization

target.value: Support the country in implementing the Immunization Resource Mobilization Strategy

comment.narrative: UNICEF continues to support the MoH for advocacy so that the Government can increase the budget of two budget lines for vaccines. Thus, a workshop to disseminate the strategy for mobilizing internal funds for immunization and advocate for its implementation was organized in January 2021. As result for this year, the Government budget for vaccines has been increased: the co-financing line has been multiplied by 2.5, from 800,000,000 BIF to 2,000,000,000 BIF and the line for traditional vaccines has been multiplied by 4, from 50,000,000 BIF to 200,000,000 BIF. UNICEF continue its support to establish a special fund for financing mother and child health; advocacy continues.

The proposal has been reviewed and approved by IRC but the budget is still being negotiated between Gavi and MoH/EPI. This campaign is rescheduled for the 4th quarter of 2021.

title.narrative: WHO : Leadership, management, and coordination (LMC)
an accountability framework to improve immunization performance and zero-dose children approach is put in place in the 18 priority districts

comment.narrative: Un draft du cadre de redevabilité de la vaccination au niveau communautaire est en cours d'élaboration suite à une collecte de données et une analyse situationnelle . La validation est prévue en Fin Novembre et la mise en oeuvre à partir de Janvier 2022.

title.narrative: World Bank : Health Financing/Sustainability
1) draft of efficiency study available and presented to Government and 2) dialogue on immunization financing facilitated

target.value: Year 1 focused on analytics with the fiscal space assessment and immunization financing assessment. In 2020, the team will continue providing support around the recommendations coming out of the analytics, which includes: improving quality of public spending for PHC; improving transparency of budget formulation and execution, and improve predictability of expenditure; maintaining the high prioritization on health, while exploring opportunities to raise sector-specific taxes through the use of taxes ?win-win-win? taxes, for example cigarettes and sugary drinks etc. One specific recommendation from the report is to reassess the tarriffs paid by the RBF project to ensure financial sustainability and to incentivize full immunization coverage. Support to the World Bank will also cover the development of the health financing strategy including further analytics, as well as continuous dialogue around PFM.

comment.narrative: Dialogue on vaccine financing completed on June 24, 2021. Dialogue on health financing strategy in progress together with other development partners. Dialogue led by the WB as part of P4H process led to GoB official request for a P4H focal point based in Burundi and who will support the development of the health financing strategy.

target.value: Year 1 focused on analytics with the fiscal space assessment and immunization financing assessment. In 2020, the team will continue providing support around the recommendations coming out of the analytics, which includes: improving quality of public spending for PHC; improving transparency of budget formulation and execution, and improve predictability of expenditure; maintaining the high prioritization on health, while exploring opportunities to raise sector-specific taxes through the use of taxes ?win-win-win? taxes, for example cigarettes and sugary drinks etc. One specific recommendation from the report is to reassess the tarriffs paid by the RBF project to ensure financial sustainability and to incentivize full immunization coverage. Support to the World Bank will also cover the development of the health financing strategy including further analytics, as well as continuous dialogue around PFM.

comment.narrative: Dialogue on vaccine financing completed on June 24, 2021. Dialogue on health financing strategy in progress together with other development partners. Dialogue led by the WB as part of P4H process led to GoB official request for a P4H focal point based in Burundi and who will support the development of the health financing strategy.

title.narrative: First phase of analytical work to inform health financing strategy disseminated

target.value: Year 1 focused on analytics with the fiscal space assessment and immunization financing assessment. In 2020, the team will continue providing support around the recommendations coming out of the analytics, which includes: improving quality of public spending for PHC; improving transparency of budget formulation and execution, and improve predictability of expenditure; maintaining the high prioritization on health, while exploring opportunities to raise sector-specific taxes through the use of taxes ?win-win-win? taxes, for example cigarettes and sugary drinks etc. One specific recommendation from the report is to reassess the tarriffs paid by the RBF project to ensure financial sustainability and to incentivize full immunization coverage. Support to the World Bank will also cover the development of the health financing strategy including further analytics, as well as continuous dialogue around PFM.

comment.narrative: Efficiency study in progress. Dialogue on health financing strategy in progress together with other development partners. Dialogue led by the WB as part of P4H process led to GoB official request for a P4H focal point based in Burundi and who will support the development of the health financing strategy.

title.narrative: Analysis/dialogue on domestic financing options for immunisation and health conducted

target.value: The request for TCA support focuses on providing technical assistance and supporting policy dialogue to develop a new health financing strategy. This activity will build on previous TCA (fiscal space assessment, immunization financing assessment, on-going efficiency study and dialogue on vaccine financing). Studies highlighted that Burundi faces many challenges in mobilizing adequate domestic resources for health and ensuring those resources are allocated in an efficient and predictable manner to allow the delivery of high-quality primary health services, including immunization. For the coming year, WB TA activities will focus on drafting a situation analysis of health financing (revenue collection, resource pooling and purchasing) and producing practical key documents to support policy dialogue to develop the strategy, while prioritizing primary health care and immunization services. The purpose of this work is to support the development and implementation of a sustainable health financing strategy. It will continue the work and dialogue started on health financing in Burundi. This activity also has synergies with the WB project called KIRA supporting the PBF program with a planned additional financing in 2021, including a Gavi HSS grant cofinancing the project. The WB team will continue working with EPI/UGP and CTN FBP to help making links with the development of the new health financing strategy, focusing on equity issues to reach zero-dose children and reflecting changes in the PBF program indicators to align with this approach.

comment.narrative: Various analytical pieces are under way to support the development of the national Health financing strategy, expected by March 2022: an efficiency study is in progress with draft slides available and a discussion paper is being developed to explore sustainability of PBF. Finally, the situation analysis of health financing is being finalized by the P4H focal point with resources mobilized by P4H through FRANCE Cooperation. The Bank team has provided inputs and participated in the validation workshop of the analysis. In coordination with other development partners, the dialogue on health financing strategy is making progress towards the development of the strategy.

Le principal site qui est le CHU Kamengue est fonctionnel pour la surveillance de toutes les formes de méningites. le défi reste la disponibilité des équipements et des intrants pour faciliter la surveillance des diarrhées sous toutes ses formes et du syndrome de rubeole congénitale. une supervision a été réalisée en Mars 2021 pour faire le suivi des notifications, de collecte des échantillons et de collecte des données.

title.narrative: The surveillance indicators of vaccine-preventable diseases in all 47 Health Districts (100%) are monitored each month and written feedback is made

target.value: Support surveillance of vaccine-preventable diseases ( AFP, measles, maternal neonatal tetanus, congenital rubella, meningitis, diarrhea rotavirus ...)

comment.narrative: un SITREP de surveillance des indicateurs de la poliomyelite et de la rougeole est élaboré par le PEV en collaboration avec l'OMS chaque semaine puis partagé jusque' au niveau district et des séances de partage des données mensuelles est effectué au sein des districts sanitaires

title.narrative: WHO : Programme Implementation/Coverage & Equity

1) AAP 2020 implementation evaluated and recommendations for improvement integrated into AAP 2021. 2) PAA 2021 available. 3) 100% (47 Health Districts ) of Micro plans reviews and recommendations made to improve quality. 4) 100% of the DS receiving coaching have RR2 CV> 80%

target.value: Technical Assistant for coverage and equity/Program Implementation for the immunization (P4)

comment.narrative: le staff international poursuit son appui au programme elargi de vaccination pour renforcer l equite dans la vaccination et ameliorer les couvertures vaccinales. La chute des couvertures entre 2020 et 2021 pour les memes periodes sont liées au contexte de COVID 19 et à la population cible qui a augmenté selon ls projections de l ISTEBU. Le staff international planifie avec l appui du niveau régional de faire des séances de rattrapage des enfants sous vaccinés ou zero doses entre juillet et septembre 2021. avec la redynamisation du partenariat du groupe H6 du système des Nations Unies, Le Groupe Thématique Santé mère enfant s est élargi aux partenaires techniques et financiers . Les termes de référence seront revus pour renforcer la particpation de la société civile et des associations des académiciens et universitaires. La fonctionalité de ce groupe a permis d organiser des visites conjointes MSPLS et partenaires techniques et financiers sur le maintien des services essentiels de santé et des recommandations sont formulées aux districts sanitaires en vue de l amélioration des couvertures. Les termes de référence du cadre de redevabilité pour la vaccination sont en cours d'élaboration et seront validés d' ici le 30 Juin 2021.la disponibilité des fonds additionnels RSSIII permettra de démarrer la mise en oeuvre des micro-plans pro-équité au niveau des districts prioritaires.

target.value: Technical Assistant for coverage and equity/Program Implementation for the immunization (P4)

comment.narrative: le staff international poursuit son appui au programme elargi de vaccination pour renforcer l equite dans la vaccination et ameliorer les couvertures vaccinales. La chute des couvertures entre 2020 et 2021 pour les memes periodes sont liées au contexte de COVID 19 et à la population cible qui a augmenté selon ls projections de l ISTEBU. Le staff international planifie avec l appui du niveau régional de faire des séances de rattrapage des enfants sous vaccinés ou zero doses entre juillet et septembre 2021. avec la redynamisation du partenariat du groupe H6 du système des Nations Unies, Le Groupe Thématique Santé mère enfant s est élargi aux partenaires techniques et financiers . Les termes de référence seront revus pour renforcer la particpation de la société civile et des associations des académiciens et universitaires. La fonctionalité de ce groupe a permis d organiser des visites conjointes MSPLS et partenaires techniques et financiers sur le maintien des services essentiels de santé et des recommandations sont formulées aux districts sanitaires en vue de l amélioration des couvertures. Les termes de référence du cadre de redevabilité pour la vaccination sont en cours d'élaboration et seront validés d' ici le 30 Juin 2021.la disponibilité des fonds additionnels RSSIII permettra de démarrer la mise en oeuvre des micro-plans pro-équité au niveau des districts prioritaires.

title.narrative: 100% of the priority health districts have an RR2 CV> 80%.

target.value: Ensure national coverage in pro-equity micro-plans: support the development of pro-equity micro-plans in 100% health districts and support its implementation

comment.narrative: Les couverture en RR2 est de 76, 9% au mois de septembre . L objectif n est pas atteint et peut être imputé aux difficultés d accès aux services de vaccination liés en partie au contexte de COVID 19 et une insuffisance dans la communication et les stratégies de rattrapage des enfants sous vaccinés. L ISTEBU a également surestimé les cibles de la vaccination cette année ce qui a réduit considérablement toutes les couvertures.

target.value: Ensure national coverage in pro-equity micro-plans: support the development of pro-equity micro-plans in 100% health districts and support its implementation

comment.narrative: seuls 18 districts ont développé des micro-plans. Il est prévu de développer les microplans des 29 districts qui restent et de mettre en oeuvre les 18 micro-plans. En 2020, La couverture vaccinale moyenne au RR1 est de 89,4%, seuls 16/47 districts sanitaires ont une cou-verture vaccinale < à 80% (soit 34.04%).
